title: The Body speaks, and excerpts from "Training in the Theatre-Laboratory in Wroclaw" ; Why Alice?
subject: Acting -- Study and teaching
Movement (Acting)
Experimental theater -- United States
Actors$$QActors -- Interviews
Theatrical producers and directors -- United States$$QTheatrical producers and directors -- United States -- Interviews
format: 1 videocassette (ca. 117 min.) sd., col. and b&w ; 1/2 in.
description: Program one, The Body Speaks, begins with an interview of the late Polish actor/dancer Ryszard Cieslak by Margaret Croyden. The interview is followed by a performance in two parts by Cieslak and two Danish students. These performances consist of dance-like "exercises" for actors intended to demonstrate how body movement can be as useful and expressive dramatically as any other component of the actor's craft. The "exercises," performed without music, are in two parts entitled "The Plastiques" and "The Corporals," each utilizing different parts of the body. Cieslak was the star of the Polish Laboratory Theatre, directed by Jerzy Grotowski. Program two, Why Alice? presents a complete performance of a piece of "performance theater" based on the writings of Lewis Carroll, and directed by André Gregory. The performance is interspersed with segments of an interview of director Gregory by John Lahr. They discuss, among other things, the difficulties inherent in the dramatic presentation of a literary classic such as Alice in Wonderland. The actors are members of the New York University School of the Arts Theatre Company, the Manhattan Project, and are presented by Lyn Austin and Oliver Smith in association with Extension, Inc.
contributor: New York University. School of the Arts. Theatre Company. The Manhattan Project.$$QNew York University. School of the Arts. Theatre Company. The Manhattan Project.
addtitle: Training in the Theatre-Laboratory in Wroclaw
Excerpts from Training in the Theatre-Laboratory in Wroclaw
contents: Program one: The Body Speaks: part 1. The Plastiques (ca. 30 min.) -- part 2. The Corporals (ca. 28 min.). Program two: Why Alice? part 1. (ca. 28 min.) -- part 2. (ca. 29 min.)
relatedwork: Carroll, Lewis, 1832-1898. Alice's adventures in Wonderland.$$QCarroll, Lewis, 1832-1898. Alice's adventures in Wonderland.
lds60: Two separate and independent programs, each consisting of two parts, compiled on one videocassette.
Program one, The Body Speaks, recorded December 6th, 1975, at the CBS Broadcast Center, New York City ; Program two, Why Alice?, recorded December 1, 1970.
On opening frames of Program one: Episode # 38-75 ; Episode # 39-75.
lds64: Program one, The Body Speaks: produced and directed by John Musili ; commentary written by Margaret Croyden ; art direction, Jim Ryan. Program two, Why Alice? Directed by André Gregory ; for Camera Three: host, James MacAndrew ; producer, director, Merrill Brockway ; writer, Stephan Chodorov ; settings by Neil De Luca.
lds65: Participants: Program one, The Body Speaks: Ryszard Cieslak, two anonymous Danish students, interviewer, Margaret Croyden. Program two, Why Alice?: André Gregory and John Lahr ; host, James MacAndrew ; actors, Gerry Bamman, Tom Costello, Saskia Noordhoek Hegt, Jerry Mayer, Angela Pietropinto, Larry Pine.
